description: The scheme aims to make quality generic medicines available at affordable prices to all, especially the poor and the deprived. It operates through dedicated outlets called Janaushadhi Kendras.
benefits: Prices of Janaushadhi medicines are 50%–90% less than those of branded medicines.
Medicines are procured only from World Health Organization-Good Manufacturing Practices (WHO-GMP)-certified suppliers.
Each batch of the drug is tested at laboratories accredited by the ‘National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL).
Operating agency gets a 20% margin on the MRP (excluding taxes).
Normal Incentive: Incentive provided to Kendra owners has been enhanced to up to ₹ 5,00,000/- per month.
Special Incentive: A one-time incentive of ₹ 2,00,000/- is provided for furniture & fixtures and computers & printers to Kendras opened in specific areas or by certain entrepreneurs.
Janaushadhi Suvidha Sanitary Napkins are available at Re.1/- per pad.
eligibility: Individual applicants must have a D. Pharma/B. Pharma degree, or employ holders of these degrees.
Organizations/NGOs applying must employ B. Pharma / D. Pharma degree holders.
In government hospital premises, NGOs/Charitable organizations are preferred, but individuals are also eligible.
documents: Own space or hired space (minimum 120 sq feet) with supporting documents.
Proof of securing a pharmacist with registration details.
Financial capacity documents (ITR, Bank Statement, PAN/Aadhar).
Drug License in the name of “Pradhan Mantri Janaushadhi Kendra”.
Certificate of SC/ST or Divyang (PWD) (if applicable).
ITR for the last two years.
Bank statement for the last 6 months.
Details of the Department that has allocated the space (for government agencies).
